name: heat production, propane, at industrial furnace >100kW | heat, district or industrial, other than natural gas | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/11127/documentation

This dataset represents heat production from the combustion of propane in industrial furnaces greater than 100 kW.;The dataset is based on an adaptation of from ecoinvent v3.0 dataset "heat production, natural gas, at industrial furnace >100kW, GLO 2000". ;Modified flows: ;fuel input: propane; Carbon dioxide, fossil emissions: stoechiometric calculation based on hypothetical commercial propane composition (see table below); Sulfur dioxide emissions: stoechiometric calculation based on sulfur content. Commercial propane composition: 90% propane and propene; 10% ethane, ethene, butane and butene; and 0.005% (w/w) sulfur content (http://www.cfbp.fr/proprietes-des-gpl/specifications-administratives-n312, consulted on 2013-05-29);;. The following table shows the calculation for energy content and carbon dioxide emissions (individual hydrocarbons heating values taken from Table B.1 in Felder, R. M., Rousseau, R. W. (1986) Elementary Principles of Chemical Processes, 2nd ed.,Wiley):

This activity starts with the reception of the fuel and other necessary inputs (electricity).

This activity ends with 1MJ of heat produced by the furnace. 
This dataset also includes the emissions due to fuel combustion.
category: D:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/35:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/353:Steam and air conditioning supply/3530:Steam and air conditioning supply

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Emission data, but for carbon dioxide and sulfur dioxide, extrapolated from Switzerland conditions.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: "Fan burners on market (modulating or non-modulating, non-condensing)." as cited in ecoinvent v3.0 dataset "heat production, natural gas, at industrial furnace >100kW, GLO 2000".
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: This dataset has been adapted from an original dataset covering the geography Switzerland for natural gas use. The uncertainty has been adjusted accordingly.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: "Literature, manufacturers; CO and NOx emissions from (SVGW 2002), sample size (number of selected devices for which emission values are given in SVGW list): CO 133, NOx 181." as cited in ecoinvent v3.0 dataset "heat production, natural gas, at industrial furnace >100kW, GLO 2000".
